oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Iron Foundry Workers, United States Pipe & Foundry Company
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African American Iron and steel workers; Iron industry and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the foreground, two African American men wearing overalls hoist an iron flask. Railroad tracks run in between the two, and a spur track curves to go inside the gable-roofed brick building behind them. Other worker are present, stacks of iron pipe visible on site.

The predecessor to the United States Pipe & Foundry Company, the Chattanooga Pipe and Foundry Works, was opened in 1877. Over the years the company consolidated with others to form the United States Pipe & Foundry company. Many of the company's workers, particularly during the late 19th and early 20th centuries, were African American.
